channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A Gaza Cease-Fire Plan, and Justice Alito Secretly Recorded
item.description: Plus, a dispatch from the U.S.-Mexico border.

item.title: Search for Malawi Vice President’s Missing Plane Extends Into Second Day
item.description: The authorities lost contact on Monday with the military aircraft carrying Saulos Chilima and nine others.

item.title: Europe plotting to keep last remaining Russia-Ukraine gas pipeline flowing with Azerbaijan’s help
item.description: European officials are speaking with energy companies in Azerbaijan about whether they could inject gas into the last remaining Russia-Ukraine pipeline to keep it flowing.

item.title: Buoyed by Election, Meloni Basks in the Spotlight as Italy Hosts the G7
item.description: The Italian prime minister was a rare leader to be fortified by the vote for the European Parliament. This week she has a chance to show her influence on an even broader stage.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: U.N. Security Council Passes U.S.-Backed Cease-Fire Resolution
item.description: The resolution laid out a three-phase plan that begins with an immediate cease-fire. Neither Israel nor Hamas has formally embraced the plan.

item.title: BP managers told to disclose office romances from the last 3 years or face the sack
item.description: BP updated is rules months after sacking its CEO Bernard Looney for "not being fully transparent" about past relationships.

item.title: Issues Affecting Women Take Center Stage as Southern Baptists Hold Annual Meeting
item.description: Delegates will vote on whether to tighten restrictions on women in pastoral leadership and whether to condemn the use of in vitro fertilization.

item.title: Buoyed by Election, Meloni Basks in the Spotlight as Italy Hosts the G7
item.description: The Italian prime minister was a rare leader to be fortified by the vote for the European Parliament. This week she has a chance to show her influence on an even broader stage.

item.title: ‘Trolls of Wall Street’ review: A smart, unsettling take on investing in the social media age
item.description: Nathaniel Popper's new book offers an unprecedented view into new forces on Reddit and elsewhere that are becoming a permanent part of the investing landscape.

item.title: Age Limit for Congressional Candidates Is on North Dakota’s 2024 Ballot
item.description: A vote on Tuesday on a proposed age limit for members of Congress is a rare chance to find out what voters actually believe about politicians and age.

item.title: Bill Gates Is Backing a Nuclear Power Project in Wyoming.
item.description: Work is starting in Wyoming coal country on a new type of reactor. Its main backer, Bill Gates, says he’s in it for the emissions-free electricity.

item.title: Bureau of Land Management is cutting proposed size of Idaho wind farm project by almost half
item.description: The proposed Lava Ridge wind farm has drawn opposition from people who have said the project endangers the Minidoka National Historic Site.

item.title: Torture Accusations Could Lead to Civil Rights Case in Mississippi
item.description: Federal authorities investigating the “Goon Squad” in a suburban sheriff’s office have widened their investigation, seeking out more victims of brutality.

item.title: Palestinians in the West Bank Are Living in the Shadow of the War in Gaza
item.description: Since the Hamas-led attacks on Oct. 7, Israel has tightened its grip on the occupied West Bank. Two Palestinians describe how they have been impacted – and their worries for the future.

item.title: Is breakfast endangered? Disease and extreme weather are jacking up coffee and orange juice prices—and consumers are getting squeezed
item.description: Climate change’s impact on food supply and prices is squeezing the most important meal of the day.
